DataElement.preferredName: Strong Cytochrome P450 3A4 Inhibitor Cytochrome P450 3A5 Induction Medication Administration Last Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the last date of the administration of a medication that either strongly inhibits CYP3A4 (encoded by human CYP3A4 Gene), whose activity seems a key predictor of drug responsiveness and toxicity, or strongly induces Cytochrome P450 3A5 (encoded by the human CYP3A5 gene), a protein involved in the oxidation of steroids, fatty acids, and xenobiotics.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Strong Cytochrome P450 3A4 Inhibitor Cytochrome P450 3A5 Induction Medication Administration
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: administration of a medication that either strongly inhibits CYP3A4 (encoded by human CYP3A4 Gene), whose activity seems a key predictor of drug responsiveness and toxicity, or strongly induces Cytochrome P450 3A5 (encoded by the human CYP3A5 gene), a protein involved in the oxidation of steroids, fatty acids, and xenobiotics.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Strong Cytochrome P450 3A4 Inhibitor Cytochrome P450 3A5 Induction Medication
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Having strength, power, or intensity greater than average or expected.:Any substance that inhibits the activity of the liver enzyme cytochrome P450 3A4. By inhibiting the activity of the CYP3A4 enzyme, the metabolism of CYP3A4 substrates is reduced, which leads to both increased bioavailability and plasma concentrations of these substrates.:Cytochrome P450 3A5 (502 aa, ~57 kDa) is encoded by the human CYP3A5 gene. This protein is involved in the oxidation of steroids, fatty acids, and xenobiotics.:The act of bringing about something.:A drug product that contains one or more active and/or inactive ingredients; it is intended to treat, prevent or alleviate the symptoms of disease. This term does not refer to the individual ingredients that make up the product.

Concepts.definition: Having strength, power, or intensity greater than average or expected.
Any substance capable of decreasing the activity of cytochrome P450 3A4.
Cytochrome P450 3A5 (502 aa, ~57 kDa) is encoded by the human CYP3A5 gene. This protein is involved in the oxidation of steroids, fatty acids, and xenobiotics.
The act of bringing about something.

A drug product that contains one or more active and/or inactive ingredients; it is intended to treat, prevent or alleviate the symptoms of disease. This term does not refer to the individual ingredients that make up the product.
The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the last date of an evaluation, assessment, or treatment.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Coming after all others in time or space or degree or being the only one remaining.:a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: Coming after all others in time or space or degree or being the only one remaining.
The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.
